ngoList.title: Tamulpur Anchalik Gramdan Sangh
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Tamulpur Anchalik Gramdan Sangh is running a Khadi Gramodyog Vidyalaya with the aid of Khadi and Village Industries Commission since 22nd February 1971. It is catering to the training needs of the entire North East Region in Khadi and Village Industry sector. Young men and women from Assam, Manipur, Nagaland, Tripura, Mizoram and Meghalaya are making use of the facilities and trained in the various disciplines. Apart from the technical, know how in spinning, weaving, design weaving and processing they are trained for a disciplined life, which is highly helpful for the future life. All the trained are either employed in the institution, which deputed them or self employed, earning a reasonable income. The Vidyalaya is run on the concept of education with learning by doing and full involvement of learners. Theory and practice go simultaneously. Right from 4 am. to 9 p.m. the learners are fully engaged without wasting a single second. Every trainee is assigned specific responsibilities in the corporate life from cleaning to cooking. The mess is completely managed by the trainees and accounts are kept meticulously. Thus, the trainees learn home economics and management by practice. After completion of respective courses, the trainees achieved perfect skill in the trade technically and artistically. In fact, they are composing poems on fabrics and they make their lives a sweet and melodious poem. The Vidyalaya provides opportunities for developing their esthetic talents also. Many of the past trainees are now holding responsible position in Khadi & Village Industry institutions. Several others have started their own institutions to serve the community. In their own homes they have proved themselves as ideal sons, daughters, son-in-laws, daughter-in-laws and parents radiating happiness, contentment and harmony. The disciplined corporate life during training period in the Vidyalaya ranging from three months to one year is contributing a great deal towards their personality development, capacity building, conscientization, empowerment and sensitization on issues like gender equity, human rights and concerned for others. In conclusion, the trainees gain training for a perfect human being. The Vidyalaya is managed by a team of experts who are professionally qualified for the job with an efficient principal with managerial and administrative proficiency of excellence. With the aid of Khadi and Village Industries Commission on a very steady and systematic manner, following industries are carried on: 1. Cotton Kahdi 2. Eri Spinning and Weaving 3. Muga rearing, grainage, reeling and weaving 4. Bee â€“ keeping 5. P.C.P. Industry 6. Black smithy and carpentry industry 7. Bamboo and rattan industry 8. Village Oil Industry

ngoList.title: The Cachar Cancer Hospital Society
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Cachar Cancer Hospital and Research Centre being the one of 2 comprehensive cancer centres in Assam was established in 1996 and administered by the Cachar Cancer Hospital Society, a non-profit registered NGO having 80G exemption and FCRA (Foreign Contribution Regulation Act) status. Gov. of Assam provided land for hospital establishment and subsequent free chemo drugs, grant for pathology, MPLDS scheme funding for infrastructure extension. The hospital serves an underserved and economically impoverished community of patients from the Barak valley and other districts of Assam state and from the states of Tripura, Manipur, Meghalaya and Mizoram. The hospital sees over 3000 new and about 14000 follow-up patients annually. Gov. of Assam provided land for hospital establishment and subsequent free chemo drugs, grant for pathology, MPLDS scheme funding for infrastructure extension. Department of Biotechnology (DBT), Government of India sanctioned a grant meant for infrastructure development for promotion of research and diagnostic facilities at the Cachar Cancer Hospital and Research Centre (CCHRC) in 2010. DBT Grant secured the establishment of Department of Molecular Oncology to initiate research activities in cancer biology at CCHRC. We regularly organize conferences, popular lecture and workshops in key areas of cancer research. Students of M.Ch, DNB, MS, PhD, M.Sc, M. Tech and B.Tech program visit our centre round the year for training and skill up gradation. We work with different departments like biotech, social work, mass com of Assam University (A Central University) in areas of molecular epidemiology and preventive oncology. National Institute of Technology, Silchar (NIT) with support from C-DAC has tied up with us for telemedicine facility to expand the horizon of cancer care in rural part of Southern Assam. The hospital has an active preventive oncology program through which we consistently makes efforts to create awareness on cancer, its causes, prevention and treatment. Awareness programmes, that average about two a week, are organized to reach populations in educational institutions, NGOs, government organizations and villages in different localities. Hospital teams visit different communities, averaging two a month, and conduct screening programmes for cancer in cooperation with local clubs and the panchayats. Screening is usually done for oral, cervical and breast cancer. The hospital organizes programmes like â€œNo tobacco month,â€ â€œWorld No Tobacco Day,â€ â€œBreast cancer awareness month,â€ â€œPink ribbon day,â€ â€œInternational day for the elderly,â€ and â€œWorld hospice and palliative care dayâ€ as means of enhancing awareness and sensitivity to health related issues and to encourage a healthy lifestyle.

sourceOfFunds.departmentName: State Level Advisory Committee For Students and Youth Welfare
sourceOfFunds.purpose: In this project of the government of Assam, initiated by the State level advisory Committee for students and youth welfare, Assam decided to provide coaching programme for union public service commission (UPSC) in four district of Assam i.e. Kamrup (M), Diphu (Karbi Anglong), Dibrugarh and Cachar (Silchar) w.e.f. 12.5.2017. The primary agenda of the programme was to mentor student for the union public service commission preliminary examination. This programme not only benefited the students.

This was a six months training for coaching for combined competitive exam for students from the minority communities of Assam, sponsored by the Assam Minorities Development Board. This training was residential one and students from many backwards regions of Assam availed the opportunity of preparing for the competitive examinations. The students not only developed confidence but also significant amount of subject knowledge in the concerned areas of the examination syllabus.
We are applying for a significant number of projects where the grants have not been sanctioned as yet.
